description:
Job Title: Senior Manager, Business Development

Reports to: Director, Marketplace

Job Location: Los Angeles, CA

Job Class: Exempt


About SHEIN

SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!


Position Summary

We seek a dynamic and experienced Senior Manager, Partnerships (Senior Manager, Business Development) who will be responsible for driving Seller growth and our Marketplace presence via Technology and Service Partners for our Los Angeles based corporate office. S/he will work closely with current and prospective partners as well as internal Seller Marketing and Business Development teams to create strategies, events, partnerships and collaborations to maximize the top of funnel B2B acquisition through the partner channel. This is a critical role with a high level of visibility within the Marketplace leadership team and the broader Marketplace landscape. The ideal candidate has expert knowledge of the key Technology, Fulfillment, payment and agencies within the online Ecommerce ecosystem. This position will be building a team and report directly to the US Marketplace Leader.


Job Responsibilities

Partnership Development:

  • Prospect, develop and execute strategies for partners which are live or soon to be live to drive growth and enhance operational efficiencies within SHEIN’s marketplace ecosystem.
  • Evaluate partnership agreements, ensuring mutually beneficial terms and conditions for both parties.


Relationship Management:

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for existing and prospective partners, in terms of developing focused and precise pipeline building which fostering strong and collaborative relationships.
  • Coordinate with cross-functional teams including Seller marketing, Business Development, Seller Onboarding, and Seller Success to ensure alignment and successful partnership outcomes.
  • Regularly assess partner performance and implement strategies to optimize partnerships and maximize value.


Strategic Initiatives:

  • Lead initiatives to maximize Seller pipeline via partners into SHEIN’s ecosystem, ensuring seamless integration and onboarding processes.
  • Drive joint marketing and promotional activities with partners to increase visibility and sales on SHEIN’s platform.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to develop innovative solutions and offerings that leverage partner capabilities and technologies.


Market Analysis and Insights:

  • Conduct market research and analysis to identify trends, competitive landscape, and potential partnership opportunities.
  • Utilize insights to develop data-driven strategies and recommendations for partnership expansion and optimization.


Performance Tracking and Reporting:

  • Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the success of partnerships.
  • Prepare and present regular performance reports and dashboards to management, highlighting achievements, challenges, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Build, cultivate and lead team of Partnership Business development professionals to maximize performance


Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing, or a related field.
  • 7+ years of experience in partner management, business development, or strategic partnerships within e-commerce, retail, or online marketplaces.
  • Proven track record of successfully managing relationships with aggregators, integration partners, 3PLs, and technology partners (e.g., Channel Advisor, Feedonomics, Seller Cloud).
  • Strong negotiation and contract management skills, with a focus on creating win-win partnerships.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data and insights to drive decision-making.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and CRM software.


Pay:

$107,600 - $180,200 + bonus


Benefits and Perks

Healthcare (medical, dental, vision, prescription drugs)

Health Savings Account with Employer Funding

Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare and Dependent care)

Company-Paid Basic Life/AD&D insurance

Company-Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability

Voluntary Benefit Offerings (Voluntary Life/AD&D, Hospital Indemnity, Critical Illness, and Accident)

Employee Assistance Program

Business Travel Accident Insurance

401(k) Savings Plan with discretionary company match and access to a financial advisor

Vacation, paid holidays, floating holiday and sick days

Employee discounts

Free weekly catered lunch

Dog-friendly office (available at select locations)

Free gym access (available at select locations)

Free swag giveaways

Annual Holiday Party

Invitations to pop-ups and other company events

Complimentary daily office snacks and beverages

SHEIN Distribution is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workplace environment.
